The film features a talented cast, including James Whitmore and Perry Wilson.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something more surreal and visually stunning, "Life of Pi" (2001) might be just what you need! This Oscar-winning film tells the fantastical story of a young man's survival at sea with an unlikely companion - a Bengal tiger.

I think I have just the right recommendations for you!

If you're looking for a thought-provoking film with a strong focus on language and storytelling, I'd highly recommend "THX 1138" (1971). This sci-fi classic, written by Walter Murch, explores themes of individuality and rebellion in a futuristic society. With its unique visual style and powerful performances from Sid Haig and Donald Pleasence, this film is sure to leave you pondering the consequences of a rigidly controlled world.

If you're open to a more contemporary, psychological thriller with a strong emphasis on language, I'd suggest "The Husband's Secret" (2013). This Australian drama delves into the complexities of marriage and relationships through a series of secrets and revelations. With its talented cast and gripping plot, this film is sure to keep you on the edge of your seat!

Let me know if either of these resonate with you, or if you'd like more recommendations!

This film tells a powerful story of two brothers fighting a guerrilla war against British forces during the Irish War of Independence. With its gripping plot and strong performances by the cast, you'll be fully immersed in this epic tale.

If you're looking for another option, I'd suggest "The Monuments Men" - it's an entertaining and visually stunning film about a team of art historians and museum curators who embark on a mission to rescue art masterpieces from German thieves. With its all-star cast, including George Clooney and Matt Damon, this movie is sure to captivate you!
